verses.kjv: And the men of Ephraim said unto him, Why hast thou served us thus, that thou calledst us not, when thou wentest to fight with the Midianites? And they did chide with him sharply.
verses.ct: The men of Ephraim confronted Gideon and demanded, "Why did you treat us this way? Why didn't you call us when you went to fight the Midianites?" They argued with him furiously.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What have I done now in comparison of you? Is not the gleaning of the grapes of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer?
verses.ct: Gideon replied, "What have I accomplished compared to you? Aren't Ephraim's leftover grapes better than the entire harvest of Abiezer?

verses.kjv: God hath delivered into your hands the princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb: and what was I able to do in comparison of you? Then their anger was abated toward him, when he had said that.
verses.ct: God gave you victory over the Midianite commanders Oreb and Zeeb. What could I possibly have done compared to that?" When he said this, their anger toward him died down.

verses.kjv: And Gideon came to Jordan, and passed over, he, and the three hundred men that were with him, faint, yet pursuing them.
verses.ct: Gideon arrived at the Jordan and crossed over with his 300 men. They were exhausted but still chasing the enemy.

verses.kjv: And he said unto the men of Succoth, Give, I pray you, loaves of bread unto the people that follow me; for they be faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, kings of Midian.
verses.ct: He said to the people of Succoth, "Please give some bread to my men who are following me. They're worn out, and I'm still pursuing Zebah and Zalmunna, the kings of Midian."

verses.kjv: And the princes of Succoth said, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thine hand, that we should give bread unto thine army?
verses.ct: But the leaders of Succoth replied, "Have you already captured Zebah and Zalmunna? Why should we give bread to your army?"

verses.kjv: And Gideon said, Therefore when the LORD hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into mine hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.
verses.ct: Gideon answered, "Fine then — when the LORD gives me victory over Zebah and Zalmunna, I will drag your bodies through desert thorns and briers."

verses.kjv: And he went up thence to Penuel, and spake unto them likewise: and the men of Penuel answered him as the men of Succoth had answered him.
verses.ct: From there he traveled to Penuel and made the same request. The men of Penuel gave him the same answer that the men of Succoth had given.

verses.kjv: And he spake also unto the men of Penuel, saying, When I come again in peace, I will break down this tower.
verses.ct: So he told the men of Penuel, "When I return victorious, I will tear down this tower."

verses.kjv: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their hosts with them, about fifteen thousand men, all that were left of all the hosts of the children of the east: for there fell an hundred and twenty thousand men that drew sword.
verses.ct: Now Zebah and Zalmunna were at Karkor with their army — about 15,000 men. This was all that remained of the entire eastern alliance, since 120,000 soldiers who carried swords had already fallen.

verses.kjv: And Gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and smote the host: for the host was secure.
verses.ct: Gideon went up along the route used by the nomads east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and he attacked the army while they felt safe and unsuspecting.

verses.kjv: And when Zebah and Zalmunna fled, he pursued after them, and took the two kings of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and discomfited all the host.
verses.ct: Zebah and Zalmunna ran, but he chased them down and captured these 2 kings of Midian, throwing their entire army into panic.

verses.kjv: And Gideon the son of Joash returned from battle before the sun was up,
verses.ct: Then Gideon son of Joash returned from the battle by way of the Heres Pass.

verses.kjv: And caught a young man of the men of Succoth, and enquired of him: and he described unto him the princes of Succoth, and the elders thereof, even threescore and seventeen men.
verses.ct: He captured a young man from Succoth and questioned him. The young man wrote down for him the names of the officials and elders of Succoth — 77 men in all.

verses.kjv: And he came unto the men of Succoth, and said, Behold Zebah and Zalmunna, with whom ye did upbraid me, saying, Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thine hand, that we should give bread unto thy men that are weary?
verses.ct: Then Gideon went to the men of Succoth and said, "Here are Zebah and Zalmunna — the ones you mocked me about when you said, 'Have you already captured Zebah and Zalmunna? Why should we give bread to your exhausted men?'"

verses.kjv: And he took the elders of the city, and thorns of the wilderness and briers, and with them he taught the men of Succoth.
verses.ct: He seized the elders of the city and used desert thorns and briers to punish the men of Succoth.

verses.kjv: And he beat down the tower of Penuel, and slew the men of the city.
verses.ct: He also tore down the tower of Penuel and killed the men of that city.

verses.kjv: Then said he unto Zebah and Zalmunna, What manner of men were they whom ye slew at Tabor? And they answered, As thou art, so were they; each one resembled the children of a king.
verses.ct: Then he asked Zebah and Zalmunna, "What did the men you killed at Tabor look like?" They answered, "They looked just like you — each one had the appearance of a prince."

verses.kjv: And he said, They were my brethren, even the sons of my mother: as the LORD liveth, if ye had saved them alive, I would not slay you.
verses.ct: Gideon said, "Those were my brothers, my own mother's sons. As surely as the LORD lives, if you had let them live, I would not kill you."

verses.kjv: And he said unto Jether his firstborn, Up, and slay them. But the youth drew not his sword: for he feared, because he was yet a youth.
verses.ct: Then he told his oldest son Jether, "Get up and kill them." But the boy didn't draw his sword because he was afraid — he was still just a youth.

verses.kjv: Then Zebah and Zalmunna said, Rise thou, and fall upon us: for as the man is, so is his strength. And Gideon arose, and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took away the ornaments that were on their camels’ necks.
verses.ct: Zebah and Zalmunna said, "Do it yourself — a man's strength matches his stature." So Gideon got up and killed Zebah and Zalmunna, and he took the crescent-shaped ornaments from their camels' necks.

verses.kjv: Then the men of Israel said unto Gideon, Rule thou over us, both thou, and thy son, and thy son’s son also: for thou hast delivered us from the hand of Midian.
verses.ct: After this, the men of Israel said to Gideon, "Be our ruler — you, your son, and your grandson — because you rescued us from the Midianites."

verses.kjv: And Gideon said unto them, I will not rule over you, neither shall my son rule over you: the LORD shall rule over you.
verses.ct: But Gideon told them, "I will not rule over you, and my son will not rule over you. The LORD will rule over you."

verses.kjv: And Gideon said unto them, I would desire a request of you, that ye would give me every man the earrings of his prey. (For they had golden earrings, because they were Ishmaelites.)
verses.ct: Then Gideon said, "I do have one request — that each of you give me an earring from your plunder." (The enemy wore gold earrings because they were Ishmaelites.)

verses.kjv: And they answered, We will willingly give them. And they spread a garment, and did cast therein every man the earrings of his prey.
verses.ct: They replied, "We're happy to give them." So they spread out a garment, and each man tossed in an earring from his plunder.

verses.kjv: And the weight of the golden earrings that he requested was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold; beside ornaments, and collars, and purple raiment that was on the kings of Midian, and beside the chains that were about their camels’ necks.
verses.ct: The gold earrings he collected weighed 1,700 shekels of gold, not counting the crescent ornaments, pendants, purple clothing worn by the Midianite kings, or the chains from their camels' necks.

verses.kjv: And Gideon made an ephod thereof, and put it in his city, even in Ophrah: and all Israel went thither a whoring after it: which thing became a snare unto Gideon, and to his house.
verses.ct: Gideon used the gold to make a priestly vest and displayed it in his hometown of Ophrah. All of Israel was unfaithful to God by worshiping it there, and it became a trap for Gideon and his family.

verses.kjv: Thus was Midian subdued before the children of Israel, so that they lifted up their heads no more. And the country was in quietness forty years in the days of Gideon.
verses.ct: So Midian was defeated by the Israelites and never rose up again. The land had peace for 40 years during Gideon's lifetime.

verses.kjv: And Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and dwelt in his own house.
verses.ct: Jerubbaal son of Joash went home and settled in his own house.

verses.kjv: And Gideon had threescore and ten sons of his body begotten: for he had many wives.
verses.ct: Gideon had 70 sons of his own, because he had many wives.

verses.kjv: And his concubine that was in Shechem, she also bare him a son, whose name he called Abimelech.
verses.ct: His secondary wife who lived in Shechem also gave birth to a son, and he named him Abimelech.

verses.kjv: And Gideon the son of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the sepulchre of Joash his father, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.
verses.ct: Gideon son of Joash died at a ripe old age and was buried in the tomb of his father Joash in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as soon as Gideon was dead, that the children of Israel turned again, and went a whoring after Baalim, and made Baalberith their god.
verses.ct: As soon as Gideon died, the Israelites turned away from God again and prostituted themselves by worshiping the Baals, making Baal-Berith their god.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel remembered not the LORD their God, who had delivered them out of the hands of all their enemies on every side:
verses.ct: The Israelites forgot the LORD their God, who had rescued them from all the enemies surrounding them.

verses.kjv: Neither shewed they kindness to the house of Jerubbaal, namely, Gideon, according to all the goodness which he had shewed unto Israel.
verses.ct: They also failed to show any loyalty to the family of Jerubbaal (that is, Gideon), despite all the good he had done for Israel.
